com.spazedog.lib.rootfw3.containers

Class Data<DATATYPE extends Data<DATATYPE>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spazedog.lib.rootfw3.containers.Data<DATATYPE>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileExtender.FileData, ShellExtender.ShellResult

    public class Data<DATATYPE extends Data<DATATYPE>>
extends java.lang.Object
    This container is used to store any kind of data. All of the data is located within a String Array, where each index is considered a line.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Data.DataReplace
      This interface is used as the argument for the replace() method.
      static interface  Data.DataSorting
      This interface is used as the argument for the sort() and assort() methods.

      • Data

        public Data(java.lang.String[] lines)
        Create a new Data instance.
        Parameters:
        lines - An array representing the lines of the data

    • Method Detail

      • replace

        public DATATYPE replace(Data.DataReplace dataReplace)
        This can be used to replace part of a line, or the whole line. It uses the replace() method in the DataSorting interface where custom replacement of a line can be done. It parses the original line as an argument, and requires the new line to be returned.
        Parameters:
        DataSorting - An instance of the DataSorting class which should handle the line replacement
        Returns:
        This instance

      • replace

        public DATATYPE replace(java.lang.String contains,
               java.lang.String newLine)
        This can be used to replace whole lines based on a contained pattern.
        Parameters:
        contains - The pattern which the line should contain
        newLine - The new line that should be used as a replacement
        Returns:
        This instance

      • assort

        public DATATYPE assort(Data.DataSorting test)
        This is used to determine whether or not to remove lines from the data array. Each line will be parsed to the custom DataSorting instance and then removed upon a true return.
        Parameters:
        DataSorting - An instance of the DataSorting class which should determine whether or not to remove the line
        Returns:
        This instance

      • assort

        public DATATYPE assort(java.lang.String contains)
        This is used to determine whether or not to remove lines from the data array. Each line will be compared to the argument. If the line contains anything from the argument, it will be removed from the data array.
        Parameters:
        contains - A string to locate within each line to determine whether or not to remove the line
        Returns:
        This instance

      • sort

        public DATATYPE sort(Data.DataSorting test)
        This is used to determine whether or not to keep lines in the data array. Each line will be parsed to the custom DataSorting instance and then removed upon a false return.
        Parameters:
        DataSorting - An instance of the DataSorting interface which should determine whether or not to keep the line
        Returns:
        This instance

      • sort

        public DATATYPE sort(java.lang.String contains)
        This is used to determine whether or not to keep lines in the data array. Each line will be compared to the argument. If the line contains anything from the argument, it will not be removed from the data array.
        Parameters:
        contains - A string to locate within each line to determine whether or not to remove the line
        Returns:
        This instance

      • sort

        public DATATYPE sort(java.lang.Integer start)
        See Also:
        sort(Integer, Integer)

      • sort

        public DATATYPE sort(java.lang.Integer start,
            java.lang.Integer stop)
        This is used to determine whether or not to keep lines in the data array. The method will keep each index within the start and stop indexes parsed via the arguments.
        Note that the method will also except negative values.
        Example 1:
        Remove the first and last index in the array
        sort(1, -1)
        Example 2:
        Only keep the first and last index in the array
        sort(-1, 1)
        Parameters:
        start - Where to start
        stop - Where to stop
        Returns:
        This instance

      • assort

        public DATATYPE assort(java.lang.Integer start,
              java.lang.Integer stop)
        This is used to determine whether or not to remove lines from the data array. The method will remove each index within the start and stop indexes parsed via the arguments.
        Note that the method will also except negative values.
        Example 1:
        Remove the first and last index in the array
        sort(-1, 1)
        Example 2:
        Only keep the first and last index in the array
        sort(1, -1)
        Parameters:
        start - Where to start
        stop - Where to stop
        Returns:
        This instance

      • assort

        public DATATYPE assort(java.lang.Integer start)
        See Also:
        assort(Integer, Integer)

      • trim

        public DATATYPE trim()
        This method will remove all of the empty lines from the data array
        Returns:
        This instance

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String separater)
        This will return a string of the data array with custom characters used as line breakers
        Parameters:
        start - A separator character used to separate each line
        Returns:
        The data array as a string

      • getLine

        public java.lang.String getLine()
        Returns:
        The last non-empty line of the data array

      • getLine

        public java.lang.String getLine(java.lang.Integer aLineNumber)
        See Also:
        getLine(Integer, Boolean)

      • getLine

        public java.lang.String getLine(java.lang.Integer aLineNumber,
                       java.lang.Boolean aSkipEmpty)
        This will return one specified line of the data array.
        Note that this also takes negative number to get a line from the end and up
        Parameters:
        aLineNumber - The line number to return
        aSkipEmpty - Whether or not to include empty lines
        Returns:
        The specified line

      • size

        public java.lang.Integer size()
        Count the lines in the data array
        Returns:
        The number of lines
